SEARCH
Package executor.service.facade.parallel

Class ConfigurableThreadPool

java.lang.Object
java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
executor.service.facade.parallel.ConfigurableThreadPool
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, Executor, ExecutorService
@Component public class ConfigurableThreadPool extends ThreadPoolExecutor
Custom implementation of ThreadPoolExecutor providing additional features.

The ConfigurableThreadPool extends the standard ThreadPoolExecutor to offer enhanced functionality for monitoring and measuring task execution times. It incorporates the following features: - A ThreadLocal to store the start time of each thread's task execution. - An AtomicLong to track the total number of tasks executed by the pool. - An AtomicLong to accumulate the total time spent executing tasks.

This component is annotated with @Component, indicating that it is a Spring-managed bean. It can be injected into other Spring components and utilized as part of the application's infrastructure for managing and monitoring thread pool behavior.

It is crucial to consider thread safety when using this class in a multi-threaded environment due to the shared state maintained by the AtomicLong instances. Properly configure and manage this thread pool to align with the concurrency requirements of the application.

Use the provided methods and fields to monitor and analyze the performance and workload of the thread pool, facilitating optimization and troubleshooting.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ConfigurableThreadPool

      public ConfigurableThreadPool(ThreadPoolConfig threadPoolConfig)
      Custom implementation of ThreadPoolExecutor with configuration options.

      The ConfigurableThreadPool extends the standard ThreadPoolExecutor to provide configurable parameters for core pool size, maximum pool size, and keep-alive time. It is constructed with a ThreadPoolConfig instance to customize these properties based on specific requirements.

      This constructor enables the creation of a thread pool with the specified core pool size, maximum pool size, and keep-alive time. The thread pool utilizes a LinkedBlockingQueue for task queuing, ensuring proper handling of tasks in case the pool is saturated.

      It is essential to carefully configure the ThreadPoolConfig object to align with the concurrency requirements and resource constraints of the application. The provided thread pool can then be utilized for managing concurrent tasks in a controlled and efficient manner.

      Parameters:
      threadPoolConfig - The ThreadPoolConfig providing configuration options such as core pool size, maximum pool size, and keep-alive time.
      See Also:
      • ThreadPoolExecutor
      • ThreadPoolConfig
      • LinkedBlockingQueue

  • Method Details

    • beforeExecute

      protected void beforeExecute(Thread t, Runnable r)
      Called by a thread prior to executing a task in the thread pool.

      This method is invoked before a thread starts executing a task in the thread pool. It extends the behavior of the standard ThreadPoolExecutor.beforeExecute(Thread, Runnable) method to include additional logging and tracking of the start time for the task execution.

      The method logs a trace message indicating the start of the task execution, including details such as the thread identifier and the runnable task. It also records the start time using a ThreadLocal variable to capture the nanosecond precision time.

      Enhance the functionality of this method based on specific requirements or add additional behaviors for monitoring and profiling the thread pool's execution.

      Overrides:
      beforeExecute in class ThreadPoolExecutor
      Parameters:
      t - The thread that will run the task.
      r - The task that will be executed.
      See Also:
      • ThreadPoolExecutor.beforeExecute(Thread, Runnable)
      • ThreadLocal

    • afterExecute

      protected void afterExecute(Runnable r, Throwable t)
      Overrides the ThreadPoolExecutor.afterExecute(Runnable, Throwable) method to perform post-execution tasks after a thread has completed the execution of a task.

      The afterExecute method is called by a thread after a task has completed execution. In this implementation: - The end time of the task execution is recorded, and the total time spent on the task is calculated using the previously recorded start time. - The number of executed tasks is incremented, and the total execution time is updated. - A trace-level log message is generated, indicating the end of the thread and task, along with the time spent on the task.

      This method allows for post-execution tasks such as logging, monitoring, or collecting performance metrics. The recorded task time and aggregated metrics can be used for analyzing the behavior and performance of the thread pool.

      Overrides:
      afterExecute in class ThreadPoolExecutor
      Parameters:
      r - The task that has completed execution.
      t - The exception thrown during the execution of the task, or null if no exception occurred.
      See Also:
      • ThreadPoolExecutor.afterExecute(Runnable, Throwable)
      • beforeExecute(Thread, Runnable)
      • ThreadLocal
      • AtomicLong

    • terminated

      protected void terminated()
      Overrides the ThreadPoolExecutor.terminated() method to perform tasks upon the termination of the thread pool.

      The terminated method is called when all threads in the pool have completed execution, and the pool is being shut down. In this implementation: - An average execution time per task is calculated using the total execution time and the number of tasks executed. - A trace-level log message is generated, indicating the termination of the thread pool along with the calculated average execution time.

      This method provides an opportunity to perform cleanup, logging, or other termination-related tasks. The calculated average execution time can be valuable for analyzing the overall performance of the thread pool during its lifecycle.

      Overrides:
      terminated in class ThreadPoolExecutor
      See Also:
      • ThreadPoolExecutor.terminated()
      • afterExecute(Runnable, Throwable)
      • AtomicLong
